no_more_50_words: American Idol is a singing competition.
50_to_100_words: On American Idol, all the contestants had to wait for their turn to sing because the format of the show is a singing competition. Each contestant is given the opportunity to perform a song in front of a panel of judges, who then provide feedback and score the performance. The contestants are eliminated over the course of the competition until a winner is chosen. Since singing is the central activity of the show, all contestants must wait for their turn to perform in order to be evaluated by the judges and potentially advance in the competition.
